1.description: Implement application controls to manage and control execution of software, including allowlisting remote access programs.

2.description: Apply recommendations in CISA's joint Guide to Securing Remote Access Software.

3.description: Audit the network for systems using RDP.

5.description: Enforce account lockouts after a specified number of attempts.

8.description: Disable command-line and scripting activities and permissions.

9.description: Restrict the use of PowerShell, using Group Policy, and only grant access to specific users on a case-by-case basis.

10.description: Update Windows PowerShell or PowerShell Core to the latest version and uninstall all earlier PowerShell versions.

12.description: Configure the Windows Registry to require User Account Control (UAC) approval for any PsExec operations requiring administrator privileges.

13.command: Disable File and Printer sharing services
13.description: Disable File and Printer sharing services. If these services are required, use strong passwords or Active Directory authentication.

14.description: Implement a recovery plan to maintain and retain multiple copies of sensitive or proprietary data and servers in a physically separate, segmented, and secure location.

15.description: Maintain offline backups of data, and regularly maintain backup and restoration (daily or weekly at minimum).

16.description: Require all accounts with password logins to comply with NIST's standards for developing and managing password policies.

17.description: Use longer passwords consisting of at least 15 characters.

18.description: Store passwords in hashed format using industry-recognized password managers.

19.description: Add password user “salts” to shared login credentials.

21.description: Implement multiple failed login attempt account lockouts.

23.description: Refrain from requiring password changes more frequently than once per year.

24.description: Require administrator credentials to install software.

25.description: Require phishing-resistant multifactor authentication for all services to the extent possible.

26.description: Keep all operating systems, software, and firmware up to date.

27.description: Segment networks to prevent the spread of ransomware.

28.description: Identify, detect, and investigate abnormal activity and potential traversal of the indicated ransomware with a networking monitoring tool.

29.description: Install, regularly update, and enable real time detection for antivirus software on all hosts.

31.description: Consider adding an email banner to emails received from outside your organization.

32.description: Ensure all backup data is encrypted, immutable, and covers the entire organization’s data infrastructure.
